'On the budget, Donald Trump's obsession consists of fulfilling impossible campaign promises'
subhead: After 150 days in office, doubts about the US economic policy are mounting. Widespread uncertainty, serious damage to the country's credibility, and the rising deficit threaten the international financial system's stability, writes Le Monde columnist Stéphane Lauer.

title: Trump's messianic allies lead the charge against Gaza
Death penalty possible for suspected killer of Minnesota lawmaker
subhead: The murderous nighttime spree early on Saturday morning began with the shooting of John Hoffman and his wife and ended with the killing of Melissa Hortman and her husband. But it had two other stops in between, the acting US Attorney for Minnesota said on Monday.
byline: Le Monde with AP and AFP

title: Netanyahu suggests killing Iran's supreme leader would end conflict
subhead: The Israeli leader insisted his country's deadly aggression to 'defang' Iran was justified, and equated Ayatollah Ali Khamenei to a 'modern Hitler': 'He just will not stop, but we're going to make sure that he doesn't have the means to carry out his threats,' adding that Israel is 'doing what [it needs] to do.'

title: WhatsApp boss: Meta AI doesn't see your conversations, 'only the messages you send it'
subhead: Will Cathcart, head of Meta's subsidiary, announced the launch of WhatsApp channels with subscriptions and advertising. He says the rollout of artificial intelligence does not compromise the privacy of encrypted messaging.
byline: By Morgane Tual and Alexandre Piquard

title: The son's suicide, the father's murder and the tormented killer
subhead: Samuel Matias Batista is on trial in southwestern France for the 2019 killing of Guy Lecomte, whom he held responsible for his friend Danaël's 2015 suicide. The murderer has proven to be articulate and transparent regarding his criminal act.

Viktoria Krykunova's 'double punishment': A refugee from eastern Ukraine faces enemy collaboration charges
subhead: While living in the Russian-occupied hometown of Svatove, the young woman worked for an office tasked with distributing pensions, which were funded by Moscow, to residents. Ukrainian prosecutors have requested a seven-year prison sentence for her.

title: Was the Trump phenomenon a historical accident? Reinterpreting the history of the American right
subhead: Convinced that political liberalism was deeply rooted in the US, American historians long downplayed the far right's influence within the conservative movement. In light of new historiography, Trump appears less a historical accident and more the result of a long gestation.

title: 'Netanyahu called Trump's bluff' by striking Iran
subhead: In an interview with Le Monde, Kamala Harris's former national security adviser criticizes the concept of 'peace through strength' that underpins current American foreign policy. He also acknowledges the Biden administration's mistakes, particularly in the war in Gaza.
byline: Interview by Piotr Smolar (Washington (United States) correspondent)
